arts.ttl: A heart-stopping win for Mallorca in Las Palmas
arts.sum: Ten-man Mallorca ended a winless run of three matches that had seen them fail to score a goal, after a thrilling, action-packed game in Gran Canaria on Saturday night when they beat a resurgent Las Palmas 2-3. Mallorca gained strength after the goal and added a second ten minutes later, when Robert Navarro opened his account for the season after a fine through ball by Mojica made it 0-2.

arts.ttl: Barcelona star ruled out of Las Palmas clash
arts.sum: Barcelona were on Saturday evening dealt a blow on the personnel front. This came as midfielder Marc Casadó picked up a suspension, which will rule him out of the club’s…

arts.ttl: Mallorca star sent off for showing middle finger to opponent
arts.sum: RCD Mallorca star Vedat Muriqi was shown a red card for an altogether bizarre reason on Saturday evening. As much came en route to Mallorca’s victory over Las Palmas. Jagoba…

arts.ttl: Real Mallorca vs. Las Palmas: Injury woes, player analysis, and match preview
arts.sum: – Real Mallorca face a resurgent Las Palmas in their Estadio Gran Canaria tomorrow night (Saturday 23rd) at 6.30pm, with six players on the injured list including Abdon Prats and Pablo Maffeo, who both have hamstring problems and are likely to be unavailable for several weeks. In the last five meetings between the sides, Las Palmas have won one, Mallorca two, with two games drawn.
